newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Qantas to impose jet fuel surcharge.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Qantas to impose jet fuel surcharge.

text.p: Australia's largest airline Qantas Airways Ltd said on Wednesday it planned to introduce a 12 Australian cents a kilogram surcharge on long haul international freight rates from November 18 in reaction to higher fuel prices.
Qantas spokeswoman Belinda de Rome said Qantas would add a six cents a kilo surcharge on freight to New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.
De Rome said she was unaware whether there were plans for increased passenger air fares due to higher jet fuel costs.
"Jet fuel prices have risen and that has increased costs and we can no longer absorb this," De Rome told Reuters.
Qantas is 25 percent owned by British Airways Plc.
